intro: Acer pictum subsp. pictum, commonly known as the painted maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its striking red to orange-red leaves that turn vibrant hues in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a rounded, pyramidal shape when young. Its leaves are palmately lobed with serrated edges and a distinctive red margin. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas along river valleys.
